p: Despite the large number of studies identified in this systematic review, only four studies assessed the efficacy of interventions to ameliorate the impact of health emergencies on mental health of HCWs. None of them was a randomized controlled trial. During the last six months (since the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic) we have witnessed a proliferation of a large volume of studies examining the impact of COVID-19 on HCWs´ mental health. To make progress in this area, future studies should address these limitations of the available literature. The use of validated measurement tools and more representative sample sizes are warranted in order to strengthen the quality of future cross-sectional studies. Robust trials are however much more needed to identify effective interventions to reduce mental health problems in HCWs. Intervention studies should adhere to international reporting standards such as CONSORT ( de Rooij et al., 2020) and TIDieR ( Hoffmann et al., 2014).
